Package edu.thinkbox.math.matrix

Class Matrix

java.lang.Object
edu.thinkbox.math.matrix.Matrix
public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
This class represents a Matrix, which is a set of numbers arranged in rows and columns so as to form a rectangular array. The numbers are called elements, or entries, of the matrix. Matrices have wide applications in engineering, physics, economics, and statistics as well as in various branches of mathematics.
Author:
Wilson S. Moreno

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Matrix matrix)
      Compares the matrix object with another matrix if their size and entries are equal.
      Parameters:
      matrix - another object of the Matrix class.
      Returns:
      true if the matrices are equal in size and entries and false otherwise.

    • add

      public void add​(Matrix matrix) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Adds the value of the entries of another matrix to the value of the entries of the matrix object. The matrices should be of the same size. If A = a[ row ][ column ] and B = b[ row ][ column ], this takes the form A + B = a[ row ][ column ] + b[ row ][ column ]. Note that addition is not defined for matrices of different sizes.
      Parameters:
      matrix - another object of the Matrix class.
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException - in the case that the matrices is of different sizes.

    • subtract

      public void subtract​(Matrix matrix) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Subtracts the value of the entries of another matrix to the value of the entries of the matrix object. The matrices should be of the same size. If A = a[ row ][ column ] and B = b[ row ][ column ], this takes the form A - B = a[ row ][ column ] - b[ row ][ column ]. Note that subtraction is not defined for matrices of different sizes.
      Parameters:
      matrix - another object of the Matrix class.
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException - in the case that the matrices is of different sizes.

    • scalarProduct

      public void scalarProduct​(double scalarValue)
      Multiply every entries of the matrix object with a scalar value. More generally, if A is any matrix and k is any number, the scalar multiple kA is the matrix obtained from A by multiplying each entry of A by k.
      Parameters:
      scalarValue - is the value multiplied to each entry of matrix object.

    • multiply

      public Matrix multiply​(Matrix matrix) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException

    • dotProduct

      public Matrix dotProduct​(Matrix matrix) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException

    • transpose

      public void transpose()
      Transpose the entries of the matrix object. If A is an m x n matrix, the transpose of A, is the n x m matrix whose rows are just the columns of A in the same order.

    • power

      public Matrix power​(int r) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException

    • copy

      public void copy​(Matrix matrix) throws MatrixSizeMismatchException
      Copies the corresponding entries of another matrix object to the entries of the calling matrix object.
      Parameters:
      matrix - another object of the Matrix class.
      Throws:
      MatrixSizeMismatchException - in the case that the matrices is of different sizes.

    • negative

      public void negative()
      Turns the matrix object to its negative matrix. The negative of an m x n matrix A ( written -A ) is defined to be the m x n matrix obtained by multiplying each entry of A by -1. If A = a[ row ][ column ], this becomes -A = -a[ row ][ column ].

    • isSquare

      public boolean isSquare()
      Determines if the size of the row and column of the matrix object is equal.
      Returns:
      true if the size of the row and column of the matrix object is equal, and false otherwise.

      public Matrix getRowVector​(int row)
      Returns a row vector with entries from the row index.
      Parameters:
      row - the index of the row where the entries will be copied.
      Returns:
      Matrix object with 1 row and contains the entries of the matrix from row index.

      public boolean isVector()

      Returns:
      true if the matrix is a row or column vector, and false otherwise.

    • createRowMatrix

      public static Matrix createRowMatrix​(int columns)
      Creates a matrix object of size 1 x n. A 1 x n matrix is called a row matrix.
      Parameters:
      columns - is the number of columns in the row matrix.
      Returns:
      a matrix object of size 1 x n.

    • createColumnMatrix

      public static Matrix createColumnMatrix​(int rows)
      Creates a matrix object of size n x 1. An n x 1 matrix is called a column matrix.
      Parameters:
      rows - is the number of rows in the row matrix.
      Returns:
      a matrix object of size n x 1.

    • createSquareMatrix

      public static Matrix createSquareMatrix​(int n)
      Creates a matrix object of size n x n. An n x n matrix is called a square matrix.
      Parameters:
      n - is the the number of rows and columns of the square matrix.
      Returns:
      a matrix object of size n x n.

    • createIdentityMatrix

      public static Matrix createIdentityMatrix​(int n)
      Creates a identity matrix object of size n x n. An identity matrix is a square matrix with 1's on the main diagonal (upper left to lower right), and zeros elsewhere.
      Parameters:
      n - is the number of rows and columns of the identity matrix.
      Returns:
      a identity matrix object of size n x n.
